Query: Rename all files in a folder with a prefix in a single unix command

Answers.MP Summary: strip directory and suffix from filenames
Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Show only the file name from a path, with a suffix removed
Top-3 Similar Questions: au_1159225: Rename folders from file name [script]
Top-3 Scripts:
au_1159225: #!/bin/bash
for i in Folder*/*
do
    FILE="$(basename "$i")"
    mv "$(dirname "$i")" "${FILE%.*}"
done

#!/bin/bash
for i in Folder*/*
do
    if [[ $i =~ (jpg|png)$ ]]
    then
        FILE="$(basename "$i")"
        mv "$(dirname "$i")" "${FILE%.*}"
    fi
done

ul_537163: find . -type f -path "./*.a/processed/*" -exec sh -c '
for path; do
  prefix=${path%%.a/processed*}
  cp "$path" "test/${prefix##*/}_${path##*processed/}"
done
' sh {} +
